title: Hole-Up Area Operations
brief: Establish longer-term rest areas for food gathering and recuperation during extended evasion.
steps: Step 1: Move to hole-up area after 3-4 days of hide-and-move operations.
Step 2: Choose location near water source but position hide site well away from water.
Step 3: Set clandestine fishing devices below water surface to avoid detection.
Step 4: Gather food (nuts, berries, vegetables) while maintaining security and avoiding tracks.
Step 5: Locate fire site well away from hide site for food preparation and water boiling.
Step 6: Set traps and snares in well-camouflaged areas away from human travel routes.
Step 7: Limit occupation to maximum 72 hours.
warnings: Water sources are lines of communication - expect human traffic near them.
Move on hard rocks or logs along water banks to reduce track signs.
Camouflage and sterilize fire site after each use to prevent detection.
Keep traps away from areas where local population might discover them.
source: FM21-76_SurvivalManual.pdf — US Army Survival Manual (Chapter on Movement and Avoidance)
